content.question: Which of the following best describes the behavior of the code segment?

choices.label: The code segment works as intended.
The code segment does not work as intended because the expression (val + 0.5) should be cast to a double instead of an int.
The code segment does not work as intended because val should be cast to an int before 0.5 is added to it.
The code segment does not work as intended because the expression (int) (val + 0.5) rounds to the nearest integer only when val is positive.

content.answer: The code segment does not work as intended because the expression (int) (val + 0.5) rounds to the nearest integer only when val is positive.

skill.text: 3.C: Determine the result or output based on code that contains procedural abstractions.
